body.p:
Harrodsburg Ky
March 22nd 1861
Gov B Magoffin
Dear Sir

I recieved a few days ago your remittance of a fine against B M Cunningham for $10 -- inflicted by the Harrodsburg Police Court -- that was not the one that was giving the great trouble there was one inflicted against ^him^ during your Stay in Harrodsburg for twenty dollars & fifteen days imprisonment -- which I would like to have remitted but would not like for him to know it the fear of going to jail has caused him to remain at Home & Sober at home ever since -- His mother is disposed to take him to Missouri and have a sober Boy & a business Man made out of him -- although I have not much confidence in the experiment I make no opposition to it -- as I am disposed to resort to any reasonable ^cost & trouble^ for his restoration -- I shall delay his starting for a week or two if I can -- so that he may have time to get him perfectly sobered before he starts I should like however to have the remittance -- to be used or known only, in the event of his being accidentally caught -- before he starts to Missouri --

Harrodsburg
Po Ct.
$20 & 15 days Imp
B M Cunningham
Remission Issd
3Mar 30 1861
Remitted as to imprisonment & respite 12 mos the fine
